conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the motion of the missile and determine the forces acting on it.
The forces acting on the missile are thrust generated by rocket jet engines, gravity, and air resistance.
The thrust generated by the rocket jet engines is directed vertically upward because the rocket engine expels gas vertically downward.
The gas expulsion changes direction to downward and to the right at an angle θ (cosθ = 1/11).
The missile accelerates upward due to the thrust generated by the rocket jet engines, and the acceleration can be calculated using a = F/m.
The calculated acceleration is a = 0.1 m/s².
The horizontal and vertical accelerations can be determined using ax = vx/t and ay = vy/t.
The horizontal acceleration is ax = 0/t = 0, and the vertical acceleration is ay = 0/t = 0.
The final velocity of the missile can be determined using v = v0 + at.
The calculated final velocity is v = 0 + 0·t = 0.
The final position of the missile can be determined using x = v0t + (1/2)at².
The calculated final position is x = 0 + (1/2)·0·t² = 0.
